intro: Microschoenus, commonly known as the slender spurge, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Euphorbiaceae. It is characterized by its small, herbaceous growth habit and milky sap, which is a common feature in the Euphorbiaceae family. The plants typically have simple, alternate leaves and produce small, inconspicuous flowers. Microschoenus species are often found in arid or semi-arid regions, thriving in well-drained soils. They are sometimes used in horticulture for their ornamental value and ability to tolerate harsh environmental conditions.
